Articles.Content:
So that time has come and gone. The time where we (normally) overindulge in candy. Today is November First; International "Get Sick on last years Halloween Candy Day". But, there's a spookier side to today. Halloween was the day of spooks. And I'm sure that you'll have heard many-a-tale or two that's meant to chill your bones. So tell them! We'd love to hear em. Oh, and if you haven't heard one, just make one up!

 

I'll go first. (Heard this on the Halloween M*A*S*H episode last night)

So my Grandfather was a sailor. Well one night, there was this massive storm. His nav equipment was out, he was totally lost, and this storm was tossing his boat every which way. Well he saw a boat; The Luck of The Irish, and it looked like it knew what it was doing. So he follows the Irish in to port, and then it just sail off; clear into the night. So the next morning, he tells the Coast Guard about it. But they act confused, and told him that The Luck of The Irish had broken up and sunk to the bottom of the ocean 20 years ago...

 

Happy spooking!
